data.sentence: The word النَّجْمُ comes from the root ن ج م and is associated with the meanings: to appear/rise/begin, accomplish, ensue, proceed.

data.meanings: a hole, to pass through (a hole), bore/perforate/pierce/puncture, intense (surge), burn/blaze/flame brightly (e.g. as if to pierce through the night), ascend/reach, penetrate, struck/kindle fire, fuel for fire, a man very red, brilliant (can be applied to knowledge), a drill (instrument which perforates).
data.sentence: The word الثَّاقِبُ comes from the root ث ق ب and is associated with the meanings: a hole, to pass through (a hole), bore/perforate/pierce/puncture, intense (surge), burn/blaze/flame brightly (e.g. as if to pierce through the night), ascend/reach, penetrate, struck/kindle fire, fuel for fire, a man very red, brilliant (can be applied to knowledge), a drill (instrument which perforates).
